definitions.definition: A sequence of rhythmic steps or movements usually performed to music , for pleasure or as a form of social interaction.
examples: I do a dance when she plays the drums!
He does the Fortnite dance with his friends in school.

definitions.definition: A social gathering where dancing is the main activity.
examples: The dance we had in August 2008 is one of the greatest moments of my life!

definitions.definition: ( uncountable ) The art, profession, and study of dancing.
( uncountable ) A genre of modern music characterised by sampled beats, repetitive rhythms and few lyrics.
A piece of music with a particular dance rhythm.
( figurative ) A battle of wits, especially one commonly fought between two rivals.
examples: So how much longer are we gonna do this dance ?

definitions.definition: ( figurative , dated ) Any strenuous or difficult movement, action, or task.
( beekeeping ) A repetitive movement used in communication between worker honey bees .

main_definition: A sequence of rhythmic steps or movements usually performed to music , for pleasure or as a form of social interaction.
secondary_definitions: A social gathering where dancing is the main activity.
( uncountable ) The art, profession, and study of dancing.
( uncountable ) A genre of modern music characterised by sampled beats, repetitive rhythms and few lyrics.
A piece of music with a particular dance rhythm.
( figurative ) A battle of wits, especially one commonly fought between two rivals.
( figurative , dated ) Any strenuous or difficult movement, action, or task.
( beekeeping ) A repetitive movement used in communication between worker honey bees .

definitions.definition: A normally horizontal stripe called a fess that has been modified to zig-zag across the center of a coat of arms from dexter to sinister .

main_definition: ( heraldry ) A normally horizontal stripe called a fess that has been modified to zig-zag across the center of a coat of arms from dexter to sinister .
